concise_definition: n. 通知, 帖子, 注意, 察觉

definitions.explanation_en: A written or printed message intended to inform people of something, often posted in a public place or distributed officially.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以书面或印刷形式发布、旨在告知公众某事的信息，通常张贴在公共场所或正式分发。
definitions.example_en: There was a notice on the door saying the library would be closed for renovation.
definitions.example_cn: 门上贴了一张通知，说图书馆将因翻修而关闭。

definitions.explanation_en: An official announcement or warning issued by an authority, such as a government agency or organization.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指由权威机构（如政府机关或组织）发布的正式公告或警告。
definitions.example_en: The government issued a notice regarding new tax regulations.
definitions.example_cn: 政府发布了关于新税收规定的公告。

definitions.explanation_en: The act of becoming aware of something; attention or observation, often implying careful or deliberate perception.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指注意到某事物的行为；关注或观察，通常暗示有意识或刻意的觉察。
definitions.example_en: She took notice of the subtle changes in his behavior.
definitions.example_cn: 她注意到了他行为中的细微变化。

definitions.explanation_en: A brief written record or comment, often informal, made to remind oneself or others of something.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指简短的书面记录或备注，通常用于提醒自己或他人某事，语气较随意。
definitions.example_en: I left a notice on the fridge reminding myself to buy milk.
definitions.example_cn: 我在冰箱上留了个便条，提醒自己买牛奶。

comparison.analysis: “Announcement”（公告）通常指更正式、更广泛传播的官方声明，常用于媒体或公开场合，强调信息的公开性和权威性。而 “notice” 更常用于局部张贴或特定对象，形式更简洁，有时带有提醒或通知的性质。
“Notification”（通知）多用于数字或技术语境，指系统自动发送的提醒（如手机推送），强调技术性传递。而 “notice” 更偏向人工撰写、纸质或公开张贴的文本，语义更传统、更广泛。
“Observation”（观察）侧重于通过感官或系统性方法获取信息的过程，常用于科学或学术语境，强调客观记录。而 “notice” 作为名词时，更强调‘注意到’这一瞬间的觉察行为，不一定需要系统性或持续性。
